metadata.titleEn: Chronological and palynological data sets of Lacustrine Core in Luanhaizi Lake (0-859 cm)
metadata.description: The present data are chronological and palynological data from the Luanhaizi Lake core in the Menyuan Basin, northeastern Tibetan Plateau. We used the AMS14C method to test nine dated samples from the LHZ18 core. Bulk samples were collected from plant remains and organic-rich horizons from the core LHZ18 for accelerator mass spectrometry (AMS)14C dating. Samples were measured at Beta Labs in the USA and Lanzhou University.Pollen analysis was completed at the Key Laboratory of Western China’s Environment Systems,Ministry of Education, Lanzhou University, with 140 stratigraphic pollen samples and 10 topsoil pollen samples. Spore pollen identification statistics were carried out under a light microscope.The pollen results mainly include the number of grains of trees, shrubs, herbs and aquatic plants.
metadata.instructions: Chronological and palynological data set of Lacustrine Core in Luanhaizi Lake are stored in csv format in files named "Chronological data of Lacustrine Core in Luanhaizi Lake"," Palynological data set of Lacustrine Core in Luanhaizi Lake" and “Topsoil pollen data set of Northeastern Tibetan Plateau”. The data tables can be viewed and edited using Excel software in Microsoft Office.

Example.Question: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used to determine the chronological framework of lake sediment cores in high-altitude regions?
Example.Answer: One example of a data collection method used to determine the chronological framework of lake sediment cores in high-altitude regions is AMS14C dating. This method was applied to 9 age samples from the LHZ18 core in the Luanghai Lake Basin, using plant remains and organic-rich whole rock samples. The AMS14C dating was conducted at the Beta Laboratory in the United States and Lanzhou University.

Feature Specification.Question: What are the features of data collection methods used for lake sediment core analysis in high-altitude regions?
Feature Specification.Answer: AMS14C dating, plant remains, whole-rock samples rich in organic matter, light biological microscopy, 140 stratigraphic pollen samples, 10 surface pollen samples

Quantification.Question: How many samples were tested using the AMS14C method?

Definition.Question: What is AMS14C and how is it used in dating sediment samples in paleoclimatology research?
Definition.Answer: AMS14C, or Accelerator Mass Spectrometry radiocarbon dating, is a technique used to determine the age of carbon-containing materials by measuring the amount of carbon-14 isotopes present. In paleoclimatology research, it is used to date sediment samples, such as those from lake cores, by analyzing plant remains and organic-rich bulk samples. This method provides precise dating for understanding the chronological framework of sediment deposition.

Interpretation.Question: What can be inferred about the historical vegetation and climate changes in the northeastern part of the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau by analyzing the spatiotemporal patterns in pollens from lake core samples?
Interpretation.Answer: By analyzing the spatiotemporal patterns in pollen data, researchers can infer changes in vegetation types such as trees, shrubs, herbs, and aquatic plants over time. This information can provide insights into historical climate conditions, as different plant species thrive under specific climatic conditions. The use of AMS14C dating allows for precise chronological placement of these changes, helping to understand how vegetation dynamics have responded to past climate variations.

Goal Orientation.Question: Why is it important to use AMS14C dating methods for developing a dataset of lake sediment cores in the northeastern part of the Tibetan Plateau?
Goal Orientation.Answer: AMS14C dating methods are used to establish accurate timelines for lake sediment cores. This is crucial in the northeastern part of the Tibetan Plateau to understand historical environmental changes and ecological dynamics over time. The dating method allows researchers to correlate pollen data with specific time periods, enabling a detailed reconstruction of past climates and ecosystems.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What are the procedures and techniques used for collecting and testing dating samples in lake sediment cores, specifically utilizing AMS14C methods?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: The procedures involve testing 9 dating samples from lake sediment cores using AMS14C methods. The samples include plant remains and organic-rich whole rock samples. These AMS14C dating samples are tested at labs such as the Beta Laboratory in the USA and Lanzhou University.
